name: Vegan Blueberry Scones
description: Tender, moist Vegan Blueberry Scones with simple glaze are a wonderful addition to any breakfast or brunch! Better than Starbucks!
recipeIngredient: 8 tablespoons cold vegan butter ((or solid coconut oil))
3/4 cup almond milk ((soy or coconut milk fine))
3/4-1 cup fresh blueberries ((may use frozen as well))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, ground flaxseeds, salt and sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, ground flaxseeds, salt and sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cold vegan butter, and use a pastry cutter or your hands to work the butter into the dry ingredients. It should resemble coarse crumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cold vegan butter, and use a pastry cutter or your hands to work the butter into the dry ingredients. It should resemble coarse crumbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in the milk and vanilla, and stir until just combined. Fold in the blueberries.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in the milk and vanilla, and stir until just combined. Fold in the blueberries.

recipeInstructions.text: On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough a few times until it comes together. Flatten the dough with your hands (lightly flour your hands if sticky). Flatten it into a circle, about 1 inch thick.
recipeInstructions.name: On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough a few times until it comes together. Flatten the dough with your hands (lightly flour your hands if sticky). Flatten it into a circle, about 1 inch thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Using a pizza cutter or large knife, cut it like you would a pizza, into 8 pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Using a pizza cutter or large knife, cut it like you would a pizza, into 8 pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the scones onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 22-26 minutes, until lightly golden brown on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the scones onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 22-26 minutes, until lightly golden brown on top.

itemListElement.text: Combine the powdered sugar, milk and vanilla in a small bowl and whisk until smooth. If the glaze is too thick, add more milk. If too thin, add more powdered sugar.
itemListElement.name: Combine the powdered sugar, milk and vanilla in a small bowl and whisk until smooth. If the glaze is too thick, add more milk. If too thin, add more powdered sugar.

itemListElement.text: Let the scones cool for at least 15 minutes, then drizzle some of the glaze onto each scone. Let the glaze set before serving.
itemListElement.name: Let the scones cool for at least 15 minutes, then drizzle some of the glaze onto each scone. Let the glaze set before serving.
